definition: to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Tom's friend said he was a double-tongued liar.
sentences.chinese: 湯姆的朋友說他是個兩面三刀的騙子。

sentences.english: He thinks most people are " Phonies ", especially adults4.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲絕大多數人都是騙子，尤其是大人。

sentences.english: So how do you become a good liar?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，怎樣才能成爲一個好騙子呢？

sentences.english: We are arrant knaves all; believe none of us.
sentences.chinese: 本人們都是徹頭徹尾的年夜騙子，別信本人們。

sentences.english: I always hate phony people like that.
sentences.chinese: 我一直都很討厭像他那樣的騙子。

sentences.english: To their surprise, the so-called investor is a swindler.
sentences.chinese: 令他們喫驚的是，那個所謂的投資商是騙子。

sentences.english: Cherry blossoms dont know, good for the chance to cheat the daughter said Mr Weng good a liar.
sentences.chinese: 櫻花不認識帕良，翁因趁機騙女兒說帕良是騙子。

sentences.english: He is just a dishonest trickster.
sentences.chinese: 牀破只是一個不誠實的騙子。

sentences.english: The nation was led astray by a mountebank.
sentences.chinese: 這個國家被一個誇誇其談的騙子引入歧途。

sentences.english: I told all the Israelites to kill the prophets of Baal because they were frauds.
sentences.chinese: 我讓人們把那幾個太陽神的騙子殺了。
測試武器補充，謝帕茲騙子。

sentences.english: Well, that doesn't tell me why you wanna be a grifter.
sentences.chinese: 你可這也沒說明爲什麼你想當騙子。

sentences.english: I do my best to never, ever look like a crook.
sentences.chinese: 我盡一切所能讓你根本看不出我是個騙子。

sentences.english: You’re like a fake, ’’ she said, “faking being well.
sentences.chinese: “你就像一個騙子，”她說，“假裝自己很好。

sentences.english: The group of swindlers provided false information to entrap customers.
sentences.chinese: 這夥騙子提供假信息坑害顧客。

definition: to cheat/to swindle/to deceive/to get on (a horse etc) by swinging one leg over
that's right/sure!/rest assured!/that's good/can't go wrong
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
to suffer losses/to come to grief/to lose out/to get the worst of it/to be at a disadvantage/unfortunately
don't tell me .../could it be that...?
to press charges/to file a complaint
